Play

Sharpen your skills in minutes, not hours.

Quick, focused games that build real poker instincts.

Range Rush

Test your preflop instincts under pressure. Quick-fire decisions on whether to fold, call, or raise—see how you stack up on the leaderboard.

Equity Guesser

Guess who's ahead and by how much. A fun way to build hand-vs-hand intuition without memorizing charts.

Daily 10

10 fresh poker puzzles every day. Make your decisions, then get solver-backed analysis showing exactly where you went right—and where you went wrong.

Learn

Get better without the overwhelm.

Structured lessons that build real understanding.

Coming Soon

Learning Modules

Bite-sized lessons that teach you poker from the ground up—hand rankings, position, pot odds, ranges, and beyond. Each module mixes clear explanations with quick quizzes so concepts actually stick. Progress at your own pace, pick up where you left off, and build real skills one step at a time.

Track

See your progress, spot your leaks.

Know where you're winning and where you need work.

Session Tracking

Log every session in seconds—stakes, duration, result, location. Build a complete history of your poker journey without spreadsheets.

Analytics

Visualize your results over time. Filter by game type, stakes, or date range to understand where you're winning and where you're leaking.

Frequently asked questions

Everything you need to know about Stack Poker.

Stack Poker is built for casual poker players who want to improve without grinding solvers, watching hours of videos, or memorizing charts. Whether you play home games, low-stakes online, or just enjoy poker as a hobby, Stack Poker helps you sharpen your instincts in a fun, low-pressure way.

As little as 5–10 minutes. Most games and puzzles are designed to be played in short sessions, so you can practice whenever you have a few spare minutes—no long study sessions required.

Both. Beginners can learn the fundamentals step by step, while more experienced players can use the games and tracking tools to reinforce decision-making and spot leaks. You can engage with the parts of the app that match your skill level.

No. Stack Poker is a training and practice app. You can use it to build skills and track sessions whether you play real money, play casually with friends, or just want to understand poker better.

Stack Poker is currently available on iOS. Support for additional platforms is planned.

Yes. A web version is planned so you'll be able to use Stack Poker from your computer in the future.
